title: How to Check Your Graphics Card Memory in Windows 10

steps.title: Open Task Manager.
steps.content: Open Task Manager. You can do this by right-clicking the taskbar and selecting Task Manager or you can press the key combination Ctrl + Shift + Esc .

steps.title: Click the Performace tab.
steps.content: Click the Performace tab. It's at the top of the window next to Processes and App history .

steps.title: Click GPU 0.
steps.content: Click GPU 0 . The GPU is your graphics card and will show you its information and usage details. The card's memory is listed below the graphs in usage/capacity format. If you have more than one GPU installed, you should see more than one GPU listed here. In the top right corner, you'll see your GPUs name. [1] X Research source
